channel.title: What next?
channel.description:
I have been messing around with servers for about a month now and feel pretty competent in java. The problem is i don't really see any way i shall continue to improve if i carry on knocking out such simple things. So i'm thinking what should i do next. I do not want to move on from java yet as i am in love with it <3.
Here are a few ideas of what i might do next:
Move into client hacking/editing. Rebuild a server from scratch.(Keeping nothing at all) Try to build a private server from a new deob.(Prob the hardest and i don't know if im ready... yet.)
So what do you think people? Any other suggestions? Any comments etc?

item.title: What next?
item.dc:creator: @Eh_Pretty_Easy Eh Pretty Easy
item.description:
@Eh_Pretty_Easy wrote:

Then make IRC bots.

Read full topic

item.title: What next?
item.dc:creator: @Oh_Noes_PIERATS Oh Noes! PIERATS!
item.description:
@Oh_Noes_PIERATS wrote:

The problem with making programs is that i hate applets =] Also i suck at coming up with ideas

Read full topic

item.title: What next?
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

Eh Pretty Easy:

Stop making private servers, they suck and it’s a waste of time. Make Java programs or something like that, much better.

No it’s not. Perhaps in some ways, but I don’t think so. Making private servers is not a waste of time, it increases your knowledge of the Java language.

Read full topic
